conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.

Container A is positioned at the top left, container B is in the middle, and container C is at the top right. There are baffles of different colors (red, gray, yellow, orange, and brown) positioned diagonally within the image. Containers D and E are located at the bottom of the image.
Liquid flows downward from A, B, and C as indicated by arrows.
Liquid flows downward from A and encounters a red baffle which redirects it downward.
The liquid from A continues downward, bypassing the horizontal gray baffle.
The liquid from A flows into the container labeled D.
Liquid flows downward from B and meets the red baffle, which redirects it downward.
The liquid from B continues downward, bypassing the horizontal gray baffle.
The liquid from B flows into the container labeled E.
Liquid flows downward from C and encounters the gray baffle, which redirects it downward and to the right.
The liquid from C continues downward and flows into the container labeled E.
Based on the analysis, the liquid from A will flow into container D, while the liquids from B and C will flow into container E.
